author: CracktheDom
message:
fix(curriculum): revise some of the tests in lab-travel-agency-page (#56881)

Co-authored-by: Krzysztof G. <60067306+gikf@users.noreply.github.com>

files.patch:
@@ -87,10 +87,16 @@ You should only have one `h1` element.
 assert.lengthOf(document.querySelectorAll('h1'), 1)
 ```
 
-You should have a `p` element introducing the travel opportunities below the `h1` element.
+You should have a `p` element below the `h1` element.
 
 ```js
-assert($('p')[0]?.previousElementSibling.tagName === 'H1');
+assert.strictEqual(document.querySelector('h1')?.nextElementSibling, document.querySelector('p'))
+```
+
+Your first `p` element should introduce the travel opportunities.
+
+```js
+assert.isNotEmpty(document.querySelector('p')?.textContent?.trim());
 ```
 
 Your first `h2` element should have the text `Packages`.
@@ -99,16 +105,22 @@ Your first `h2` element should have the text `Packages`.
 assert.equal(document.querySelectorAll('h2')[0]?.innerText, 'Packages');
 ```
 
-You should have a `p` element introducing briefly the various packages below your first `h2` element.
+You should have a `p` element below your first `h2` element.
+
+```js
+assert.strictEqual(document.querySelector('h2')?.nextElementSibling, document.querySelectorAll('p')?.[1])
+```
+
+Your second `p` element should introduce briefly the various packages.
 
 ```js
-assert($('p')[1]?.previousElementSibling.tagName === 'H2');
+assert.isNotEmpty(document.querySelectorAll('p')?.[1]?.textContent?.trim())
 ```
 
 You should have an unordered list element below your second `p` element.
 
 ```js
-assert($('ul')[0]?.previousElementSibling.tagName === 'P');
+assert.strictEqual(document.querySelectorAll('p')?.[1]?.nextElementSibling?.tagName, 'UL');
 ```
 
 You should have two items in your unordered list.
